required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnostic Accuracy of Teledentistry Versus Direct Oral Examination of Elderly in Aged-Care Homes: A Pilot Cross-Sectional Study
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnostic Accuracy of Teledentistry Versus Direct Oral Examination of Elderly in Aged-Care Homes: A Pilot Cross-Sectional Study

brief_summary.textblock:
One examiner (a licensed dentist) will perform the direct oral examination of the participants and take the intraoral photographs in the aged care home.
Later, two remote examiners (licensed dentists) will assess the intraoral photographs of the same group of participants. The participant's dentition will be examined using the scores developed by the World Health Organization (WHO) for oral health surveys. Also, the examiners will perform a visual inspection of the oral mucosa for any signs of oral potentially malignant disorders (OPMD), as the mortality of high-risk populations is proven to be reduced by visual oral cancer screening. Finally, the residents will receive oral health education, and the residents who require treatment will be referred to Kasr EL Ainy dental hospital to receive dental treatments, this is similar to an integrated approach to oral health in aged care facilities in Australia .

primary_outcome.description: Decayed, Missing and filled teeth (DMFT) caries index will be used with the crowns.Also, the dentures section will be used to record the presence or absence of partial or complete dentures in both jaws.

secondary_outcome.measure: Signs of oral potentially malignant disorders (OPMD)
secondary_outcome.description: Signs for OPMD visible in the photographic views will be recorded in the section of the oral mucosal lesions in the assessment form.

clinical_study.condition: Oral Screening for Elderly in Aged Care Homes

study_pop.textblock: The participants are elderly in aged care homes in Egypt who must be able to communicate with the examiner and must be able to give consent to participate in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The participants are elderly in aged care homes who must be able to communicate with the examiner and must be able to give consent to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
-
